alert.note: Alert for City of Newport News (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 11:27AM EDT until August 28 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central, and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, in east central Virginia, Charles City. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, City of Newport News, City of Williamsburg, Gloucester, Isle of Wight, James City, Southampton, Surry, Sussex and York. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered areas with heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Localized amounts up to 2 inches of rain have fallen this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Smithfield, Gloucester Courthouse, Windsor, Waverly, Wakefield, Claremont, Surry, College Of William And Mary, Toano, Norge, Queens Lake, Disputanta, Isle Of Wight, Ivor, Dendron, Elberon, Scotland and Cabin Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
